info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 18 at 9:07PM CDT until March 18 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Glasscock County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... Mitchell County in western Texas... Reagan County in western Texas... Borden County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas...
* Until 1030 PM CDT.
* At 906 PM CDT, a dust channel was near Coahoma, or 15 miles northeast of Big Spring, moving northeast at 50 mph.
HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph.
SOURCE...Ground observations indicate less than one quarter mile visibility with a wall of dust moving through the eastern Permian Basin.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 164 and 228.
Locations impacted include... Sand Springs, Lomax, Coahoma, Big Lake, Cuthbert, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Big Spring, Dunn, Inadale, Forsan, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark, Knott, Vealmoor, Snyder, Saint Lawrence, Best, Luther, Westbrook, and Elbow.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 10:30 PM CDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 10:30 PM CDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

area.areaDesc: Borden, TX; Glasscock, TX; Howard, TX; Mitchell, TX; Reagan, TX; Scurry, TX

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 10:30 PM CDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 10:30 PM CDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.

area.areaDesc: Borden, TX; Glasscock, TX; Howard, TX; Mitchell, TX; Reagan, TX; Scurry, TX
